revised_title: Monitoring Intracellular Ammonium in Rat Salivary Gland Using N-14 NMR Spectroscopy
tldr: Researchers monitored intracellular ammonium content in a rat salivary gland using nitrogen-14 nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy. They observed an increase in intracellular ammonium content and a transient increase in intracellular pH during ammonium pulse experiments. This study suggests the possibility of ammonium influx and activation of cellular buffering mechanisms.
